title: Weird Ping Behavior
body:
I've been experiencing some lag these days, my ping is usually around 79-85, but lately it has been around 140-150. I've ran the Hextech Repair Tool a couple of times, and everytime I check the logs I see this behavior:

> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: LogOut_File: : logfile started
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: Net Status: low-level initialize success.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: Note that this new version (12/19/2011) has reduced the frequency of updates so the numbers will be larger
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: time = time of logging
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: address = address of IP address
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: incoming = total size of messages set to me in bytes. Spikes can indicate lag.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: outgoing = total size of messages set from me in bytes. Spikes can indicate lag.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: app_ctos = client to server bytes delta excluding overheads (app data only)
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: app_stoc = server to client bytes delta excluding overheads (app data only)
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: loss = number of packets lost. Can indicate lags.  Some node on the network is dropping packets or taking to long and we have to resend them.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: sent = number of packets sent. Spikes can indicate lag.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: ping = how long it takes for a packet to get back and forth. Spikes can indicate lag.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: variance = how much the ping is changing from avg ping. Spikes can indicate lag.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: reliable delayed = This occurs when we drop reliable packets from sending this frame because we are sending to much data. Unreliable are more likely to be dropped than reliable.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: unreliable delayed = This occurs when we drop unreliable packets from sending this frame because we are sending to much data.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: app update delayed = This occurs when the app is taking to long to run code caused by network packets (ie CPU) and packets are delayed until the next frame
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: Time spent in critical section (frame) = This is the time the network thread is blocking the main thread from doing anything.
> 2016-09-08T14-12-44: [time], [address], [incoming], [outgoing], [app_ctos], [app_stoc], [loss], [sent], [ping], [variance], [reliable delayed], [unreliable delayed], [app update delayed], [Time spent in critical section (frame)]
> 842,X.X.X.X,82,98,0,0,0,2,455,_**79**_,0,0,0,0
> 15954,X.X.X.X,2590,933,0,0,0,56,_**138**_,4,0,0,0,0
> 25957,X.X.X.X,16098,1891,0,0,0,73,_**138**_,3,0,0,8,0
> 35959,X.X.X.X,20241,3863,0,0,0,89,_**138**_,3,0,0,8,0
> 45962,X.X.X.X,23936,5823,0,0,0,104,_**138**_,3,0,0,8,0
> 55965,X.X.X.X,27610,7791,0,0,0,119,_**138**,3,0,0,8,0
> 2016-09-08T14-13-48: Memory Allocations 
>  Current Allocations = 2 
>  Total Allocations = 2098 
>  Max Allocations = 51 
>  Out of Pool Allocations = 27 
>  Out of Pool dealloc = 27 
> 
> 2016-09-08T14-13-49: LogOut_File: : logfile stopped

This is a log from a test run in ARAM today, my ping starts at 79 (which is usually my ping), but then it raises to 138. The second run I did, it increased to 147, and stayed there. Changed between Summoner's Rift and ARAM, but still the same thing. Forced repatch, disabled my firewall, closed my browser and game applications, and added LoL to my firewall exceptions (Windows Firewall btw). I have no clue what makes my ping skyrocket like that. I'd love to link my LoL Logs.zip, but I think it's against the rules of the forums or something? Help!

replies.body: Input delays can be due to a network issue, packet loss, or even how your ISP is routing to your server.  To find out more, you can grab your game logs and run them through the [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) for a full analysis.  It will also come with a list of troubelshooting steps to resolve your specific case.  Let me know if that helps!

Ok, so I made 3 test runs:

-1. Literally changed NOTHING at all, I just simply played again normally.

> 2016-09-08T16-18-24: LogOut_File: : logfile started

> 79722,X.X.X.X,40133,13583,0,0,0,222,_**87**_,4,0,0,10,0
> 89724,X.X.X.X,45077,15541,0,0,0,252,_**87**_,4,0,0,11,0
> 2016-09-08T16-19-59: Memory Allocations

>  Max Allocations = 41 
>  Out of Pool Allocations = 33 
>  Out of Pool dealloc = 33 
> 
> 2016-09-08T16-19-59: LogOut_File: : logfile stopped

-2. Did what the troubleshooting section told me to, after uploading the original post log.

> 2016-09-08T16-21-45: LogOut_File: : logfile started
> 2016-09-08T16-21-45: Net Status: low-level initialize success.

Worth mentioning I disconnected my PC (wired) from my router, and connected it directly to my modem.

-3. Connected my modem to my router and then to my PC (all wired), this is the way it has always been.

What is going on?

Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can look into this and find out what's going on.  I also recommend downloading [WinMTR ](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and ping to 104.160.131.1 to get an overview of your routing, and attach it to your ticket.  We'll respond to your ticket asap!
